title: Rules of the competition
text:
STV’s Euro Cup competition consists of two parts:

14 questions related to various more or less observable topics that are found at https://nettskjema.no/a/434281
An Excel form, in which the outcome of each game has to be forecasted, estimates, guessed, place-your-verb-here. Click here to download the Excel from.

The excel form consists of 36 games in the group stage and 15 games in the knockout stage. The schedule for the 36 group stage games is set and those games are specified on the left side of the form.
The first game is between Germany and Scotland. There are two cells between the two countries , and we fill in what we believe is the final score. In the illustration below the score is predicted to be a victory for Scotland.

We then repeat this for each game until the final game between the Czech Republic and Turkey.
When the score for all group stage games are filled in, the magic of Excel will automatically fill in the games in the Round of 16. We then move on to put in the scores in these games as well, which in turn will populate the Quarter finals.
We repeat this for quarter-finals, semi-finals and, finally, the final final. When the form i successfully completed, the predicted Champion 2024 will pop up in the bottom right corner.

The grey cells in group stage games 25 thorugh 36 and in the knockout rounds are for penalty shoot-outs. You may fill in these as well, but they have no relevance for the outcome of the competition.



Points are awarded for each and every correct answer to the 14 questions. In addition, we calculate the total number of goals scored in the form for a 15th question “How many goals will there be in total? (Penalty shoot-outs excluded)”. Each of these questions yield 30 points, for a total of 450 for the questions section
Points are earned for guessing the correct outcome of each of the games in the group stage. There are 36 games in the group stage Each correct answer is worth 25 points, for a total of 900 points
Points are deducted for any deviance between the predicted and observed scores. As usual in the Social Sciences, we square the deviance. If the first game is predicted a 2-0 Turkey victory over Italy but ends in a 4-1 Turkish victory, then 25 points are awarded for the correct outcome, before (4-2)2=22=4 and (1-0)2=12=1 points are deducted for slightly missing the correct result. In the end, 25 - 4 - 1 = 20 points are awarded.
Points are earned in the the knockout round for guessing the correct teams in each of the knockout stages. 25 points are awarded for each correct team, and a bonus 5 points if the team appears on the correct spot in the playoff schedule. Correctly guessing both teams in a knockout game will thus give (25 + 5) * 2 = 60 points. With 15 knockout games, the total points available is 900.
Finally, 200 points are awarded for correctly guessing the winner of the Euro2021 cup.










Source
Max points per item
N. of items
Total maximum points




Qualitative questions
30
15
450


Group stages
25
36
900


Knockout stages
60
15
900


Winner
200
1
200



The theoretical top score is therefore 2450 points.

title: Portugal hammers Turkey
text:
Friday 21th June 2024, Portugal scores three, but Ronaldo is not among the scorers
Portugal does what England and France can’t. Everyone except Jon and Martin predicted this outcome, which means that the standings change very little. Dagfinn and Vegard are ahead of large group of people that can very well be on top of the leaderboard by this time tomorrow.
Ronaldo has not yet scored a goal. But, he has at least two more games to do so.

title: Hungary vs Switzerland
text:
Saturday 15th June 2024, Hungary vs Switzerland
Switzerland won against Hungary. Øyvind is in the lead, with Philipp, Halvqrd and Jacob five points behind. On the other end of the scale, we are all in the positive range.
A few words on the colors. Dark blue means that many points were won since last game, while deep red means that many points were lost.





The graph looks kind of brutal, for some, but this will very likely change as we move along.


Who scored the first goal?
Germany.
30 points have been dished out.

title: Hungary vs Switserland
text:
Saturday 15th June 2024, Hungary vs Switzerland
Spain beat Croatia, but the score did not reflect what was a fairly evenly played game. Rodri was spared a red card by QAR intervention. Always nice to know that certains things never change.





Øyvind remains in the lead.

title: Hjulmand out!
text:
Sunday 16th June 2024, the first draw of the year
Denmark failed to win against Slovenia, and the blame must be put on the shoulders of the Danish coach, Hjulmand. As the game developed, it was evident that Denmark didn’t have the quality in midfield to secure a win. As the best midfielder in the world, Albert Grønbæk, was inexplicably left out of the squad, Hjulmand has some explaining to do.





Something has happened to the leaderboard. Øyvind, Halvard and Dagfinn are now ahead of the field. They have all, very impressively, the correct outcome of every game, but Øyvind has the most correct scores. Jostein and Jan Erling also picked up this draw. The rest of us failed more or less miserably.

title: England beats Serbia
text:
Sunday 16th June 2024, England beats Serbia but fails to impress
England was the bookmaker’s favorite to win EURO2024, but this game did not bolster their standings. Serbia could easily have left with something from the game.





We mostly saw this coming, but all the purple shows that many thought the score would be something more exiting.

title: Romania trash Ukraine
text:
Monday 17th June 2024, Romania trash Ukraine
While Ukraine had the ball, Romania scored three goals. Not bad.





Not at all a common prediction, but Felix, Philipp and Linda has closed the gap to the top. Miro and Lærke can also bragg about this outcome.

title: Poland
text:
Sunday 16th June 2024, Netherlands beat Poland
The Netherlands won, as many of us had predicted. No significant changes in the front, but Øyvind remain in the lead.

title: Netherlands - France 0-0
text:
Friday 21th June 2024, Netherlands - France 0-0
VAR rescues France and Griezmann rescues the Netherlands. The game ends 0-0.
Dagfinn has overtaken Vegard and is ahead by 20 points. Another draw, and Jon is climbing in the standings. Pål, Nina and Øivind also predicted a draw. The rest of us can only hope for a brighter tomorrow.

The color of love, the color of blood The color of roses, the color of mud The color of passion, the color of fire The color of anger, the color of desire The color of danger, the color of heat The color of victory, the color of defeat The color of life, the color of death The color of courage, the color of breath The color of war, the color of peace The color of joy, the color of grief The color of power, the color of pain The color of sunshine, the color of rain The color of beauty, the color of sin The color of the world we live in The color of red, so bold and bright The color of day, the color of night
So, for the first time ever, or at least as far as I know, we have had a totally unforeseen outcome. Belgium lost to Slovaika.
The red color in the graph tells us how much each of us lost in the prediction. The more red, the more we lost. My 4-1 bet cost me 16 points.





Halvard lost less than Øyvind, and the two share the top spot. Dagfinn also closed in on the top. Felix did the opposite and there is again a significant gap.

title: Group B was a close call
text:
Tuesday 25th June 2024, Group D came with a surprise
Austria is a very surprising winner of group D, with France in second. The Dutch are through as well, as one of the four best third placed teams.
It is shocking to see how many of us that had both outcomes tonight. In fact, except for Nina, Kristoffer and myself, everyone can feel good about their predictions tonight.





Dagfinn has a whopping 37 point lead to Jacob, with Christian and Maiken close behind. And there are still 60 points available today!

title: Group A is decided
text:
Saturday 23rd June 2024, Group A is decided. Scotland is out.
Germany and Switzerland drew, and Hungary beat Scotland. This means that Germany and Switzerland are through to the next round, and that Hungary has to wait for the other groups to finish to see if they are one of the best third placed teams. Germany vs. England is a clear possibility for the first knockout game.
Most of us saw this coming, so the leaderboard is fairly unchanged. Dagfinn was first to break the magic 400 point barrier.





Neither game was particularly anticipated, so Christian and Maiken pulled a massive, schocking climb today. Dagfinn is still in the lead, 6 points below his rating yesterday. Jacob gained points and positions, and is in second. Jostein and Jens also climbed into the top ten.
Hounorable mentions to Olav, Sverke, Tore & Lærke, while the rest of us can do better tomorrow.

title: Germany is the first team to qualify for the knockout stage
text:
Tuesday 19th June 2024, Lechfeld II
Germany, habitually, beat Hungary 2-0 and are through to the knockout stage
All but five of us had this outcome. Boring.

title: Franzzzzzzzzz
text:
Monday 17th June 2024, France beat Austria.
In a modern replay of Austerlitz France beat Austria. Following England’s yawn-inspiring win, France showed that they are a team that can lose against virtually anyone, but they didn’t today





Øyvind, Halvard & Dagfinn remain ahead by more than a games margin.

title: A draw between Croatia and Albania
text:
Tuesday 19th June 2024, Croatia and Albania are both dissapointed
Five persons predicted a draw in this game, and the narrow fields means that the standings change quite a lot. Philipp jumped up to third place, while Miro is in fifth. Jon has also raced up the charts, and is now only a game away from Øyvind in second. Christian and Dag Harald also predicted this outcome.

title: Belgium beat Romania
text:
Friday 21th June 2024, Belgium - Romania 2-0
Despite Belgium’s tragic first game and Romania’s fantastic game against Ukraine, Belgium won the game hansomly. Lukaku had yet another goal disallowed. The group is wide open.
Most of us saw this coming, so the leaderboard is fairly unchanged. Dagfinn was first to break the magic 400 point barrier.

title: Past winners
text:
This is the fifth time the competition is held. The previous winners are:
2014: Åse Gornitzka
2016: Sigurd Lindstad
2018: Ida Weseth Bjøru
2021: Øyvind Colbjørnsen

title: A few words about the competiton
text:
A few words about the competiton
“The competition is a great opportunity to learn new things and to test your skills. It is also a great way to meet new people and to have fun. I hope you will enjoy it and that you will learn a lot from it. Good luck!”
That was ChatGTP’s idea of what this blog post should contain. There is still room for improvement

title: What was that?
text:
Monday 17th June 2024, Belgium lost to Slovaika
The color of love, the color of blood The color of roses, the color of mud The color of passion, the color of fire The color of anger, the color of desire The color of danger, the color of heat The color of victory, the color of defeat The color of life, the color of death The color of courage, the color of breath The color of war, the color of peace The color of joy, the color of grief The color of power, the color of pain The color of sunshine, the color of rain The color of beauty, the color of sin The color of the world we live in The color of red, so bold and bright The color of day, the color of night
So, for the first time ever, or at least as far as I know, we have had a totally unforeseen outcome. Belgium lost to Slovaika.
The red color in the graph tells us how much each of us lost in the prediction. The more red, the more we lost. My 4-1 bet cost me 16 points.





Halvard lost less than Øyvind, and the two share the top spot. Dagfinn also closed in on the top. Felix did the opposite and there is again a significant gap.

title: Denmark - England 1-1
text:
Tuesday 19th June 2024, Denmark - England 1-1
Both Denmark and England are most probably thorugh with this result, but questions continue regarding England’s favorite status.
Vegard is now in the lead. With three games in a row ending in a draw, the organizing comittee is not surprised to see Jon making a quick climb up the scale. However, Dagfinn, Jan Erling and Halvard are all within striking distance.

title: Georgia - Czech Republic 1-1
text:
Friday 21th June 2024, Georgia - Czech Republic 1-1
For either team, a loss would mean elimination. A draw would keep both teams in the tournament, but they would need to win their last game to advance. Georgia in particular might be in a thight spot here.
Dagfinn is ahead of Vegard and Jon. Behind them a group of six is about a game behind.

title: Germany vs Scotland
text:
Friday 14th June 2024, Germany vs Scotland
Germany beat Scotland 5-1 as we celebrate summer and the start of the European Championship.





The graph looks kind of brutal, for some, but this will very likely change as we move along.


Who scored the first goal?
Germany.
30 points have been dished out.

title: Group B was a close call
text:
Monday 24rd June 2024, Group B is decided. Albania is out, Croatia hangs from a cliff
Spain B beat Albania, while Italy claimed a point with the penultimate touch of the game. We feel with Croatia.
It is shocking to see how many of us that had both outcomes tonight. In fact, except for Nina, Kristoffer and myself, everyone can feel good about their predictions tonight.





Dagfinn is in the lead, Christian, Maiken and Vegard are close behind and the cup holder Øyvind has climbed back in contention.

title: Harry Maguire is out!
text:
Harry Maguire is out!

It has been announced that Harry Maguire will not be part of England’s EURO squad, much to the relief of opposing teams who were worried about being defended by a man who moves slower than a tortoise in quicksand. Maguire’s absence will surely be a blow to England’s defensive capabilities, as his knack for getting himself tangled up in knots and looking bewildered on the pitch will be sorely missed.
But fear not, England fans, for the team still has plenty of other players who can make up for Maguire’s absence by demonstrating their own unique talents, such as collecting red cards faster than a supermarket shopper on Black Friday and providing comedic relief with their unfortunate tackling techniques.
For our competion, it means that Question 12 will be voided. The question was: “Will Harry Maguire receive a red card?”, and he will most likely not be able to do so from the stands. We will update the question and the scoring accordingly. Anyone who has answered the ceremonial positive to this question will not suffer, nor do they have to redo the form.
Please note that the two top paragraphs are written by CoPilot/ChatGPT, with the prompt “Write a short satiric text about Harry Maguire not being part of England’s EURO Squad” and “add reference to red cards”. The rest is written by me.

title: Italy beat Albania
text:
Saturday 15th June 2024, Italia beat Albania
Italia won, but conceded a goal after 23 seconds. That must hurt.





This outcome was largely anticipated by everyone. Philipp lost some ground to the top, but everything can still happen.

title: Poland - Austria 1-3
text:
Tuesday 19th June 2024, Poland - Austria 1-3
We are probably saying godbye to Poland in this tournament. Austria is now in a good position to advance to the next round.
Vegard is still in the lead, but the gap is closing. Kristoffer, Dagfin, Jacob and Christian are right behind.

title: Portugal vs. Czeck Republic
text:
Tuesday 18th June 2024, Portugal beat the Czeck Republic
Portugal won, almost everyone thought they would and the standings change very little. Nina is now a point ahead of Dagfinn in third.
I have to admit that I am not sure how to refer to the team from the Czeck Republic, and the Copilot AI is not helping me out. I will go with “the Czeck Republic” for now, but any feedback will be greatly appreciated.

title: Scotland - Switzerland 1-1
text:
Tuesday 19th June 2024, Scotland - Switzerland 1-1
Interesting turn of events! Halvard is still in the lead, but behind him, the competition is fierce. Nina and Dagfinn are again tied, this time in second place, but 11 others are less than a game behind them. Øyvind has lost quite a bit of ground today.

title: Slovakia - Ukraine 1-2
text:
Tuesday 19th June 2024, Slovakia - Ukraine 1-2
Group E is turning into a heated affair. If Belgium wins against Romania tomorrow, it is a matter of goal difference. If Belgium fails to win, they are in trouble, which has consequences for our competition.
Most of us did not see this coming. In fact, only 11 gained points from this game. Vegard remain in a clear lead, but Kristoffer, Jacob and Christian gained significantly. Well done!

title: Scotland - Switzerland 1-1
text:
Tuesday 19th June 2024, Scotland - Switzerland 1-1
Interesting turn of events! Halvard is still in the lead, but behind him, the competition is fierce. Nina and Dagfinn are again tied, this time in second place, but 11 others are less than a game behind them. Øyvind has lost quite a bit of ground today.

title: Spain - Italy 1-0
text:
Tuesday 19th June 2024, Spain - Italy 1-0
Spain is through, and so is probably Italy.
Vegard is now firmly in the lead. As the draw strike came to an end, so did Jon’s climb. Halvard is back in second. Miro and Linda edged their way into top five.
Previous kosmonaut Øyvind is now in 14th place. Things change.

title: What was that?
text:
Tuesday 18th June 2024, Turkey beat Georgia
Many thought Turkey would beat Georgia. Among them football genius Halvard. Øyvind Colbjørnsen stumbled, so we have a clear leader. The OPA trio Jostein, Jan Erling and Kristoffer are racing up the charts, and Nina is sharing the third spot with Dagfinn.

title: Welcome To the ISV Euro 2024 Competition!
text:
Hi and welcome to the competition. While we wait for VAR, we can take a quick review of the past competitions.


We boycotted this event.



The 2021 EURO championship was won by Øyvind Colbjørnsen.




The 2018 competition was won by Ida




Sigurd Lindstad won the competition.
